alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 7:15PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Falls Creek and the surrounding area. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding of small streams, especially near Falls Creek. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1-0.3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible. - Heavy precipitation continues to be observed in the advisory area in satellite imagery, doppler weather radar and surface observations. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 11:00am the stage was 21.61 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet. Impacts: At 24.0 feet: Water levels will be at the bridge abutment of 9 mile bridge along Mitkof Highway. - The ongoing rains could swamp boats. Mariners should check their vessels immediately.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
